title: Why can't I find podcasts on Spotify? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because Spotify is a crappy way to listen to podcasts.  They are simply not set up for it.  Look for most of the big named podcasts and you’ll struggle to find their current episodes.  My recommendation is you go to the app or website for the podcasts you want and support those brands at their home. I’ve tried to get my show consistently published on Spotify and it’s not worth the effort.  They can’t seem to get it right. The other thing is, we’re all trying to figure out how to build an audience.  If the audience is at Spotify, or better at Melody. That’s great for the audience, but what about the artist?  What incentive do they have? If Spotify has the ears, and the audience is getting what they want, is the artist being compensated for their work?  This triangle is poorly balanced at the moment.  Spotify can’t really support the artist, and for now, doesn’t really know how to fix that problem…so the audience is going elsewhere. I hope you enjoyed my answer. Feel encouraged to connect with me on Twitter or LinkedIn. More of my work can be found on What's your Ground Truth? or my podcasts at BREAK IT DOWN SHOW or Popping the Bubbl : Technology Podcast about Silicon Valley innovation
